If the U.S. dollar is falling against the euro, it shows a weakening in U.S. currency. When the U.S. dollar is weak, it costs more to purchase foreign goods, and it costs foreign companies less to buy U.S. goods
The weakening of the U.S. dollar typically happens during easy-money periods
money available for bank loans An increase in the money available for bank loans would show an easing of the money supply, not a tightening

open market operations Although the Fed does control the discount rate and reserve requirements, the tool most commonly used by the Fed to control the money supply is open market operations. Open market operations is when the Fed buys and sells U.S. government securities, which happens on a continuous basis
setting the federal funds rate The Federal Reserve Board (FRB) is responsible for open market operations (buying and selling U.S

The full and fair disclosure thatâ€™s required on new offerings is covered under the Securities Act of 1933, not the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The Securities Act of 1933 deals with the registration of new issues, and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 deals with the trading of outstanding issues
the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 The Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 created the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC
